StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: NHLBI GO-ESP: Family Studies (Familial Atrial Fibrillation)

Person.Organization: VANDERBILT UNIVERSITYUNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS AT CHICAGO

Policy.acknowledgement_statement:
A sample statement for the acknowledgment of the NHLBI GO-ESP Family Studies: Familial Atrial Fibrillation dataset(s) follows:
“The authors wish to acknowledge the support of the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute (NHLBI) and the contributions of the research institutions, study investigators, field staff and study participants in creating this resource for biomedical research. This study is part of the NHLBI Grand Opportunity Exome Sequencing Project (GO-ESP). Funding for GO-ESP was provided by NHLBI grants RC2 HL103010 (HeartGO), RC2 HL102923 (LungGO) and RC2 HL102924 (WHISP). The exome sequencing was performed through NHLBI grants RC2 HL102925 (BroadGO) and RC2 HL102926 (SeattleGO). Samples and associated genotype and phenotype data used in this study were provided by Vanderbilt University Medical Center. Funding support was provided by the Vanderbilt Atrial Fibrillation Registry funded from the 1U01 HG004603 and R01 HL92217 NIH grants. “
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. The data may be used only for genetic studies to learn about, prevent, or treat health problems.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)
